news.item: Porting Pingus to SDL is in progress, some spelling fixes for the FAQ

Time for some news, current plans for Pingus look like this:
Jave27 is currently trying to get the latest version in a release ready state
Grumbel opened a new branch in SVN called pingus-sdl, this is supposed to port Pingus to SDL, level file format will switch to S-Expr instead of XML

It's been a long time without any updates, so there's a couple of news to note here.
Pingus got elected GotM for April at The Linux Game Tome and a 0.7 release with many new features may be expected soon.
Pingus CVS was replaced by Subversion
There will be a new release on the stable branch (0.6.1) very soon now, planned date is 15.04.2004 - cross your fingers and hope. :-)
We've got now a Level Comment Tool where you can rate all levels which are delivered with Pingus.
A added little button in the bottom left corner of the webpage that allows you to donate via Paypal.
Pingus 0.6.0 is finally out, has taken longer as expected, but here it is. It contains one island with 22 playable tutorial levels. This is the first playable release ever of Pingus.
A second prerelease of Pingus 0.6.0 is out, named 0.6.0rc2, final 0.6.0 release is expected to be finished this weekend.
A first prerelease of Pingus 0.6.0 is out, named 0.6.0rc1

After some downtime the Pingus CVS repository is up and running again. But since its now in another CVSROOT people with a checkout need either to re checkout it or editor they CVS/Root files a bit, more info is available here.
Another IRC Meeting is scheduled for the end of this week (07. Mar 2003) on Friday, 18:00 GMT. Server and channel stay the as with the last one, see below. same. Everybody is welcome.

IRC Meeting planed for the next Saturday. For details see below and the Contact Section of this site.
Server:irc.freenode.net 6667
Channel:#pingus
Date:Saturday, 1. March 2003
Time:21:00 GMT
Rumour is that a new, finally playable, release will come out in the next days... even so this isn't officially confirmed you might cross your fingers and it will probably happen.

The Webpage got finally a complete redesign, this took, as always, longer than expected, but anyway here it is. If you want to know how this page is generated you can look at the xml source and the Makefiles in the Savanna Web CVS tree.

Blender, a very powerfull 3D modelling software, might become Free Software, but to accomplish that they need to collect 100'000EUR. So if you want to help Pingus and many other free game projects, donate something to the Blender Foundation please.
[Update: Blender now is Free Software, thanks to all donators!]
Updates are still not done, but we are working on it... in the meantime you can go to the bugtracker and submit your favorit bugs in Pingus.

Mailing List and Bugtracking on the move to savanna
The bugtracking and mailing lists are on there move to http://savannah.gnu.org/projects/pingus/. Some of the info on this webpage will therefore be out dated and needs some updating, this should be done in a day or two.

The source for many Pingus images (.xcf, etc.) is now available at ftp://pingus.seul.org/pub/pingus/contrib/. That directory contains everything that I used in the development process, which is not included in the official source tarball.

I have submitted Pingus to http://unmaintained.sourceforge.net/ now. Sorry, but I simply lack the time and motivation to continue this project. So if anybody wants to help coordinating this project, they are more than welcome. Please drop a mail to pingus-devel in case you are interested to help.

Call for help!
Pingus has currently 140 levels in the XML format and another 40 levels in the old PLF/PSM format, all these need to get reviewed, rated, fixed and/or converted. So if you have some spare time, its now a good point to help! For a first overview you can get a list of all levels here. More detailed instructions on what you can do will follow soon.
some larger additions to the todo and a How to contribute guide
New ToDo list added here.
A short overview over the class structure is available here.
'pingus.cx' is down, so you currently can't reach me via grumbel@gmx.de, try grumbel@gmx.de instead.

Release 0.5.0pre2 is out
You can download it here.

Pingus is in need for new programmers! As the last month have shown this project is nearly dead, I currently simply lack the time to do anything for Pingus, so I need some help. So when you are at least a bit familiar with C++ and have some spare time to offer, please drop me a mail, so I can coordinate the efforts.

Pingus 0.5.0pre1 is out
Finally a new Pingus release is out, but be warned this is a development release (mostly for level designers) and is known to crash. When you want a playable game, this thing won't make you happy.
You can find a screenshot of the multiplayer mode here.

Multiplayer is on its way!
I am currently implementing multiplayer support (split-screen, no network support) for Pingus, cooperative and battle modes will be available.
Generated some source docs with doxygen, you can find them here

I cleaned up my Pingus directory tree, commited a bunch of missing images and levels (more to come) and fixed some bugs in the CVS version. Looks like this thing is alife again and a new release might follow soon.

item.b: Project suspended for at least another month!
item.p: Due to the lack of time and motivation I will not work on the project for at least another month, so don't expect any updates in that time. In the meantime you can have a look at some of my other projects:

news.item:
Pingus runs now on LinuxPPC!
A guide on how to compile Pingus and some PPC Clanlib and Hermes RPMs are available here, but be warned this is only experimental development stuff and it will crash often.
Arnold van Rooij wrote a dutch level editing howto

We have now an "official" IRC channel at:
Server: irc.openprojects.net
Channel: #pingus
Some more photos of the LinuxTag are available here
A Windows port of Pingus 0.4.0 is available in the download section
Added another screenshot of the new menu and a screenshot of the new weather effects
Added a screenshot of the new menu, comments welcome.

Pingus Release 0.4.0
A new release of Pingus is out, its main features are a set of fully playable levels, a lot of new gfx for the level designers and it comes as a static linked binary, no extra libraries are required - it will run out-of-the-box. Its as always available in the download section.

Level building tutorial
I have written a short level building tutorial, which explains the basics of level editing.
Some photos from the LinuxTag are available , thanks to Tamer for providing them.
New mailing list: Due to some spam problems with the old list, the Pingus mailing has now moved to SourceForge, in addition there are now also announce and users mailing lists.

LinuxTag 2000
As some might already know, Pingus will be present from the 29.06-02.07.2000 at the LinuxTag in Stuttgart/Germany

news.item: The first prerelease of Pingus 0.4.0pre1 is out, have a look on the pingus-devel list for more instruction. Warrning: prereleases are not meant for the average user, they are meant for testing and debugging, so they are not publicly available.

Pingus 0.4.0 still not ready
Pingus has currently some huge bugs, which needs to be fix before the next release, this can take another two weeks or longer, sorry. Use the CVS version for the moment.
All older Pingus releases are now available via FTP.
Added a new screenshot.
Ever wished that the Pingus could walk over your windows while you are reading you mail? A dream has come true, Robin Hogan wrote XPenguins.

Pingus 0.4.0 not ready yet
A new version of Pingus will probably released in the next two weeks, for the moment I suggest you to try the CVS version.
Pingus 0.3.1 will not work with ClanLib 0.4.2, a patch is available here, have also a look at the FAQ.
